item.description: Vose Spur at 3862 ft., forms the west wall of the deep cleft of Carrigain Notch. It is one of the New England 100 highest and hasn't any trails. Starting from the parking area on Sawyer River Road(2 miles from Rt. 302)taking Signal Ridge Trail, travel 1.7 miles to the Carrigain Notch trail. Another 1.6 miles we will come into sight of the ledges of Vose Spur and the bushwhack starts. We'll work our way up steep slopes thru dense woods and brush, up and over Vose Spur and finally arrive at the summit of Mt. Carrigain(4700 ft.). This is an advance level hike with 3850 ft. of elevation gain. Total mileage and time are unknown but could be about 10 miles.
item.how_to_find_us: blue Subaru Outback, bike racks on the roof
item.name: Vose Spur Bushwhack to Mt. Carrigain
